org.dockbox.selene.command.parameter

Interface CustomParameterPattern

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HashtagParameterPattern

    public interface CustomParameterPattern
    The type used to provide a argument pattern which can be used to construct types annotated with CustomParameter, typically done through the DynamicPatternConverter, though this is not a requirement.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • request

        <T> Exceptional<T> request(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                           CommandSource source,
                           java.lang.String raw)
        Attempts to parse a raw argument into the requested type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The generic type of the target
        Parameters:
        type - The target type to parse into
        source - The source of the command, provided in case the parser is context sensitive
        raw - The raw argument
        Returns:
        An instance of T, wrapped in a Exceptional, or Exceptional.empty() if null

      • getParameterConstructor

        default <T> Exceptional<java.lang.reflect.Constructor<T>> getParameterConstructor(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                                                  int size)
        Looks up a constructor which can be used to construct a parameter instance. If there is only one constructor present that will be returned even if it is not annotated with ParameterConstruction, as long as the amount of parameters matches the expected amount. If there are more than one constructor present, only the constructors annotated with ParameterConstruction are scanned.

        It is expected that each constructor with this annotation has a different amount of parameters. Currently it is not possible to have two constructors with the same amount of arguments, due to the unavailability of argument types during construction.

        Any Exceptional with a present Throwable returned by this method are to be handled by the developer, and should be handled before it is returned to the user.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The generic type of the declaring type
        Parameters:
        type - The type to scan for constructors
        size - The amount of parameters expected on the constructor
        Returns:
        The constructor, wrapped in a Exceptional, or Exceptional.empty()
